member.name: T:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericArgumentFinder
member.summary: Allows retrieving the concrete types of the generic type arguments of that must be used to create a closed generic implementation of a given open generic implementation, based on on the concrete arguments of the given closed base type.

member.name: T:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericArgumentFinder.ArgumentMapping
member.summary: A map containing a generic argument (such as T) and the concrete type (such as Int32) that it represents.

member.summary: Implements equality. Needed for doing LINQ distinct operations.
member.param: The other to compare to.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericArgumentFinder.ArgumentMapping.GetHashCode
member.summary: Overrides the default hash code. Needed for doing LINQ distinct operations.

member.summary: Allows validating an ArgumentMapping.

member.summary: Load both public as internal types from the given assemblies.

member.name: F:SimpleInjector.Extensions.AccessibilityOption.PublicTypesOnly
member.summary: Only load publicly exposed types from the given assemblies.

member.name: T:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for applying generic decorators.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions.RegisterOpenGenericDecorator(SimpleInjector.Container,System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Ensures that a closed generic version of the supplied decorator is returned, wrapping the original closed generic version of the registered , by injecting that service type into the constructor of the supplied . Multiple decorators may be applied to the same .

remarks.para: The RegisterOpenGenericDecorator method works by hooking onto the container's ExpressionBuilt event. This event fires after the ResolveUnregisteredType event, which allows decoration of types that are resolved using unregistered type resolution. The RegisterOpenGeneric extension method, for instance, hooks onto the ResolveUnregisteredType. This allows you to use RegisterOpenGenericDecorator on the same service type as RegisterOpenGeneric.

Multiple decorators can be applied to the same service type. The order in which they are registered is the order they get applied in. This means that the decorator that gets registered first, gets applied first, which means that the next registered decorator, will wrap the first decorator, which wraps the original service type.

member.param: The container to make the registrations in.
The definition of the open generic service type that will be wrapped by the given .
The definition of the open generic decorator type that will be used to wrap the original service type.
member.exception: Thrown when either , , or are null references.

Thrown when is not an open generic type, when does not inherit from or implement , when does not have a single public constructor, or when does not contain a constructor that has exactly one argument of type .

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions.RegisterOpenGenericDecorator(SimpleInjector.Container,System.Type,System.Type,System.Predicate{SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions.PredicateContext})
member.summary: Ensures that a closed generic version of the supplied decorator is returned, wrapping the original closed generic version of the registered , by injecting that service type into the constructor of the supplied . Multiple decorators may be applied to the same .

remarks.para: The RegisterOpenGenericDecorator method works by hooking onto the container's ExpressionBuilt event. This event fires after the ResolveUnregisteredType event, which allows decoration of types that are resolved using unregistered type resolution. The RegisterOpenGeneric extension method, for instance, hooks onto the ResolveUnregisteredType. This allows you to use RegisterOpenGenericDecorator on the same service type as RegisterOpenGeneric.

Multiple decorators can be applied to the same service type. The order in which they are registered is the order they get applied in. This means that the decorator that gets registered first, gets applied first, which means that the next registered decorator, will wrap the first decorator, which wraps the original service type.

member.param: The container to make the registrations in.
The definition of the open generic service type that will be wrapped by the given .
The definition of the open generic decorator type that will be used to wrap the original service type.
The predicate that determines whether the must be applied to a service type.
member.exception: Thrown when either , , , or are null references.

Thrown when is not an open generic type, when does not inherit from or implement , when does not have a single public constructor, or when does not contain a constructor that has exactly one argument of type .

member.name: T:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions.PredicateContext
member.summary: An instance of this type will be supplied to the delegate that is that is supplied to the RegisterOpenGenericDecorator overload that takes this delegate. This type contains information about the decoration that is about to be applied and it allows users to examine the given instance to see whether the decorator should be applied or not.

member.name: P:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions.PredicateContext.ServiceType
member.summary: Gets the closed generic service type for which the decorator is about to be applied. The original service type will be returned, even if other decorators have already been applied to this type.

member.name: P:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions.PredicateContext.ImplementationType
member.summary: Gets the type of the implementation that is created by the container and for which the decorator is about to be applied. The original implementation type will be returned, even if other decorators have already been applied to this type. Please not that the implementation type can not always be determined. In that case the closed generic service type will be returned.

member.name: P:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions.PredicateContext.AppliedDecorators
member.summary: Gets the list of the types of decorators that have already been applied to this instance.

member.name: P:SimpleInjector.Extensions.GenericDecoratorExtensions.PredicateContext.Expression
member.summary: Gets the current object that describes the intention to create a new instance with its currently applied decorators.
member.value: The current expression that is about to be decorated.
